SENT.plain: The emergence of certain skin conditions belonging to the group of mucocutaneous paraneoplastic syndromes may indicate the future appearance of a previously unknown malignancy
Sweet's Syndrome and relapsing polychondritis are included in this group
Sweet's Syndrome and relapsing polychondritis are very rarely found together in the same patient
This dual occurrence is more commonly found in cancer patients with associated hematological malignancies
We report the case of a 79 year-old male with Sweet's Syndrome and relapsing polychondritis, who was subsequently diagnosed with a myelodysplastic syndrome
